title: MEP Survival Guide: How to navigate the bubble
text:
MEP Survival Guide: How to navigate the bubble A roundup of the best from POLITICO’s 72-page magazine for Brussels newcomers.

Welcome to POLITICO’s MEP Survival Guide, an introduction to navigating the EU bubble and understanding what makes the European Parliament tick.

Pick up the magazine (or read it in its original form here) to get the full low-down on how things work in Brussels and Strasbourg — from what to wear to plenary to who to get to know behind the scenes and where to plot out of earshot from journalists.

We’ve pulled out a few highlights for you below. Happy reading, and welcome to the EU sausage-making machine!

The institution has established itself as the stage where the EU's conflicts are acted out. By Tim King.

POLITICO asked MEPs what hard-won wisdom they'd pass on to the incoming class.

There's more to Brussels than endless traffic and Eurocrats. By Derek Blyth.

We chart the surest paths to power for new Parliament officials. By Ryan Heath and Maïa de La Baume.

Our guide to where to scheme in the European capital. By Maïa de La Baume.

Harassment, misuse of funds, spying — Brussels has seen it all. By Ryan Heath.

From CAP reform to truckers legislation, the new Parliament will have to pick up on burning issues left open by the outgoing one.

If there's one issue no one can afford to ignore, it's climate change. By Florian Eder.

A guide to unpicking what's fueling the Continent's biggest feuds. By Jacopo Barigazzi.

Fun in the European Parliament

Ready for something lighter? Print this out (click here for a PDF) and grab some crayons. By Paul Dallison and Dom McKenzie.

Quick pops

What to wear: How to stand out — or blend into the background — as an MEP.

Do you speak European Parliament? We help translate the EU jargon with a Parliament glossary.

10 tricks to understanding Parliament: How to avoid missteps in voting, picking a committee and hiring staff.

8 people who make Parliament tick: Meet the most influential backstage schemers.
